meanings.definition: To make a low, guttural sound.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog was grunting softly in its sleep.
meanings.sent2: The pig was grunting happily while rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The grunting noise coming from the engine sounded like it was trying to talk.
meanings.sent4: The old floorboards were grunting under the weight of the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's opponent let out a loud grunting noise as he lifted him off the ground.

meanings.definition: A low, guttural sound made by an animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion's grunting could be heard from afar in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The grunting of the cows in the barn signaled feeding time.
meanings.sent3: The grunting of the hippo made the zoo visitors giggle.
meanings.sent4: The grunting of the bear echoed through the forest at night.
meanings.sent5: The grunting of the gorilla was both intimidating and fascinating to the researchers.

meanings.definition: A low, guttural sound made by a person.
meanings.sent1: The man's grunting while lifting weights showed his effort.
meanings.sent2: The grunting of the old man as he stood up indicated his discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The grunting of the toddler trying to open the jar was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The grunting of the singer added a unique touch to the song.
meanings.sent5: The grunting of the worker lifting heavy boxes filled the warehouse with sound.
